attributes.action: Rehabilitate misbehaving children rather than excluding them from school
attributes.background: Excluding misbehaving children from school for a fixed period does not fix bad behaviour. These children see exclusion as extra time off school rather than a punishment. Attending to the support of a professional instead of staying at home for a week would ensure the same mistake does not occur.

rejection.details:
A school's behaviour policy - including deciding on punishments for particular behaviour - is the responsibility of the headteacher. You can find out more about this here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/488034/Behaviour_and_Discipline_in_Schools_-_A_guide_for_headteachers_and_School_Staff.pdf
